faqs.subtitle: Here you will find answers to the most frequently asked questions about our company and its information

0.question: What is the legal form and name of the company?
0.answer: KARIHOME LLC's legal form is a limited liability company (LLC) and it is registered in the Kingdom of Morocco in Kenitra city under commercial registry number 72857, and its legal name is written as "KARIHOME".

1.question: What is the basis for pricing company services?
1.answer:
Pricing in the company is based on:

• The provided plans necessary for building the project.

• Based on the type of project.

2.question: What are the services provided and what is the scope of work?
2.answer: Implementation of construction and interior decoration projects, along with providing construction services and selling primary materials needed for construction.

3.question: What are the required documents when signing the contract?
3.answer:
The required documents are:

• Civil engineer's plan.

• Area plan.

• Property ownership certificate for the real estate project or exploitation authorization.

• Building permit (or approval summary for the plans you submit).

• Commercial registry and articles of association if the project owner is a legal entity (company).

• National ID card or passport if the project owner is an individual.

• Inheritance record.

• Insurance certificate for the construction site.

firstPart.description: Companies are divided according to the nature of their work into civil companies and commercial companies. Commercial companies are further divided according to their basis on personal or financial considerations into partnerships, capital companies, and companies of mixed nature. Only commercial companies acquire merchant status, bear the obligations arising from this status, and are subject to bankruptcy laws when they stop paying their commercial debts. Civil companies can take one of the forms specific to commercial companies, such as being established as a partnership, limited partnership, limited partnership with shares, joint stock company, or limited liability company. In this file, we provide you with details on establishing a limited liability company in the Kingdom of Morocco.
features: Processing registration procedures for the articles of incorporation and domiciliation.
Commercial registry readiness within two weeks.
Conducting comprehensive feasibility studies for company operations.

secondPart.title: General
secondPart.description: A limited liability company, abbreviated as LLC in the Kingdom of Morocco. In some countries it is abbreviated as Ltd. In French: SOCIÉTÉ À RESPONSABILITÉ LIMITÉE SARL, which means: a company consisting of two or more persons, where the partner's liability for its debts, obligations, and losses is limited to the amount of their share in its capital. The partner's share is transferred upon death to their heirs or those they recommend for any share. The number of partners in this company does not exceed fifty partners.

stepsSection.title: Steps we follow to establish a limited liability company

1.title: Obtaining a negative certificate
1.description: This is the first step in establishing a company in Morocco, which involves obtaining a negative certificate that confirms that there is no similar name to the proposed company name within two months. This certificate is valid for six months.

2.title: Working on the domiciliation or lease contract
2.description: Lease contract, domiciliation contract, property ownership, or proof of building purchase where the main objective is to clarify the company's address and prove the company's right to use the property for commercial activities.

3.title: Establishing the company's articles of association
3.description: Establishing the articles of association specific to a limited liability company in Morocco, obtaining partner signatures, defining the scope of work, and determining capital and shares for each partner.

4.title: Opening a bank account with capital deposit
4.description: Opening a temporary bank account to deposit capital, and upon completion of company establishment procedures, the temporary bank account is converted to a regular company account.

5.title: Registration for property tax and tax identifier
5.description: Registration for property tax and obtaining the company's tax identifier, which is necessary to begin the company's legal and financial activities.

6.title: Required documents for establishing a limited liability company in Morocco
6.description: Collecting all required documents according to Moroccan law to ensure smooth establishment process in compliance with legal requirements.

7.title: Registration in the commercial registry
7.description: The company is registered in the commercial registry, which is the official record that legally proves the company's existence and gives it the right to conduct commercial activities.

8.title: Affiliation with the National Social Security Fund in Morocco
8.description: Registering the company and employees with the National Social Security Fund to ensure social protection and compliance with Moroccan labor laws.

9.title: Official forms
9.description: Preparing and printing all official company forms such as the official seal, correspondence, and all necessary documents to start operations.
